organic_results.title: Undergraduate definitions of learning from teachers
organic_results.snippet: Learning is, of course, integral to education. Yet the sociology of education has paid little attention to the sociological dimensions of institutionally-engendered student learning processes. Postulating that schools characteristically rely on direct interaction between a teacher and his students as a principal medium for the instigation of student learning, this paper explores the key place of student definitions of such interaction in shaping its actual learning outcomes. Specimen materials from discursive interviews with undergraduates are …

publication_info.summary: W Thielens Jr - Sociology of education, 1977 - JSTOR
